Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based, to investigate plant and animal diversity.
The student can depict a variety of living things in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or animals like lizards or squirrels.
The student can illustrate different kinds of living things in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, or aquatic plants.
The student can demonstrate an understanding of the diversity of life by showing differences between the living things in each habitat.
The student can use the drawings to compare and describe patterns of plant and animal diversity between the two habitats.
